details: A high-protein, gluten-free breakfast staple made from spiced chickpea flour and loaded with fresh vegetables.
process: Mix besan with water to form a smooth, flowy batter.
Stir in the chopped vegetables, chilies, and spices.
Heat a non-stick tawa and spread a ladle of batter thinly.
Cook on medium heat until the edges turn crisp; flip and cook the other side.
Serve with homemade mint-coriander chutney.
benefits: High protein content from chickpea flour supports muscle maintenance.
Low glycemic index helps control blood sugar.
Rich in fiber and keeps you full longer.

dish: Lauki Chana Dal (Bottle Gourd with Lentils)
details: A light yet filling main course combining the hydrating properties of bottle gourd with the protein of split chickpeas.
process: Pressure cook chana dal and lauki with turmeric, salt, and 1.5 cups of water for 2-3 whistles.
In a separate pan, sauté cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste with minimal oil.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft; stir in the cooked dal and lauki mix.
Simmer for 5 minutes and garnish with fresh coriander.
Pair with one whole wheat phulka or a small bowl of brown rice.
benefits: Bottle gourd is 90% water, aiding hydration and weight loss.
Chana dal provides sustained energy and protein.
Low in fat and easy to digest.

details: A fiber-rich one-pot meal that replaces rice with broken wheat, perfect for weight management and gut health.
ingredients: 1 cup Mixed chopped veggies (peas, beans, carrots)
process: Dry roast dalia until it smells nutty (if not pre-roasted).
In a pressure cooker, sauté cumin seeds and vegetables.
Add the dalia and 2 cups of water.
Cook for 2 whistles on medium heat.
Fluff with a fork and serve with a side of plain curd.
benefits: High fiber content promotes digestive health.
Complex carbs provide steady energy release.
Rich in B vitamins and iron.

details: A protein-heavy starter or main where the meat or cheese is marinated in yogurt and spices, then grilled without excess oil.
ingredients: 200g Paneer cubes or Lean Chicken Breast
Red chili powder, Garam masala, & Lemon juice
process: Whisk spices and lemon juice into the curd to make a marinade.
Coat the paneer/chicken and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
Skewer the pieces alternating with vegetables.
Grill in an oven or on a non-stick grill pan with a light spray of oil until charred.
Serve with a fresh onion-cucumber salad.
benefits: High protein supports muscle building and satiety.
Yogurt marinade aids digestion and adds probiotics.
Grilling method keeps it low-fat compared to frying.
